content: original pattern published by the american red cross rev jan 1942 modified wwii army gloves equipment needed yarn 2 balls of worsted weight yarn preferably superwash needles two sets of double pointed needles 2 5 mm + 3 mm scale 10 cm = 21 sts measurements glove length 26 5 cm glove width 10 cm index finger 8 cm instructions for making right hand glove cast on 48 stitches 16 on each of three needles 2 5 mm knit 2 purl 2 for 6 cm change to 3 mm needles and knit on first knit round decrease 8 stitches k2 k2tog *k4 k2tog * continue to end of round = 40 sts thumb gusset next round 1st start with p1 k2 p1 knit plain to the end of the round repeat this round twice the purled stitches mark gusset for thumb 4th round p1 inc1 k2 inc1 p1 knit plain to end of round 5th-7th round p1 k4 p1 knit plain to end of round 8th round p1 inc1 k4 inc1 p1 knit plain to end of round 9th-11th round p1 k6 p1 knit plain to end of round repeat increases on 12th and 16th round = 10 stitches between purled stitches work 4 rounds without increasing casting on 4 sts at the end of the last round in the next round slip the first 12 sts on to a thread or stitch holder for the thumb continue the round in plain knitting in next round transfer the four new stitches on to the first needle work without shaping until the glove measures 10 cm from the ribbing fingers next round knit 16 sts cast on 1 new stitch and slip next 8 sts onto a thread or stitch holder = little finger continue the round in plain knitting knit for 3 rounds or 1 cm index finger knit first 6 sts of round cast on 1 new stitch knit last 6 sts of round re-arrange needles = 13 sts continue in plain knitting until finger measures 7 cm then k2tog for 1 round cut off yarn and pull through remaining stitches middle finger knit next 5 sts of round cast on 1 new stitch knit 5 last sts of round take up 1 stitch out of index finger = 12 sts continue in plain knitting until finger measures 8 cm then k2tog for 1 round cut off yarn and pull through remaining stitches third finger knit remaining 11 sts take up 1 stitch out of middle finger = 12 sts continue in plain knitting until finger measures 7 cm then k2tog for 1 round cut off yarn pull through little finger slip all 8 sts from the stitch holder onto needles take up 2 sts out of third finger = 10 sts continue in plain knitting until finger measures 6 cm then k2tog for 1 round cut off yarn and pull through remaining stitches the thumb slip all 12 sts from the stitch holder onto needles take up 2
